subject: Travel
subcategory: The Story of Maps and Navigation
title: Chinese Mapmaking Innovations

hook.text: China had accurate grid-based maps 1,000 years before Europe. Their cartography was far ahead of its time.

buildup.text: Pei Xiu, the 'father of Chinese cartography,' created a grid system for maps in 267 AD.

discovery.text: Chinese maps included elevation, distance scales, and symbols for mountains, rivers, and cities.

twist.text: Despite this advantage, China never pursued global exploration. The maps served the emperor, not merchants.

climax.text: When European maps arrived in the 1600s, Chinese scholars were shocked to see the rest of the world.

punchline.text: The best mapmakers in the world never mapped beyond their borders.

quiz.question: Who is known as the 'father of Chinese cartography'?
